name: David Ramirez
text:
Replacing all jobs is unlikely unless there's singularity type super AI.
What's more realistic but still pretty disruptive for work as we know it is if AI gets good enough to greatly increase productivity in most fields. It could get to where all goods and services needed by the entire population can be produced and maintained by a much smaller percentage of the population than currently.
So the percentages of unemployed or part time employed experts across different task types may go up, by a lot.
